greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A078898(A003961(A003961(2*n))).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..255
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of other permutations:
example: a(4) = 9 because of the following. 2n = 2*4 = 8 = 2^3. We replace the prime factor 2 of 8 with the next prime 3 to get 3^3, then replace 3 with 5 to get 5^3 = 125. The smallest prime factor of 125 is 5. 125 is the 9th term of A084967: 5, 25, 35, 55, 65, 85, 95, 115, 125, ..., thus a(4) = 9.
mathematica: t = PositionIndex[FactorInteger[#][[1, 1]] & /@ Range[10^4]]; f[n_] := Times @@ Power[If[# == 1, 1, NextPrime@ #] & /@ First@ #, Last@ #] &@ Transpose@ FactorInteger@ n; Flatten@ Table[Position[Lookup[t, FactorInteger[#][[1, 1]] ], #] &[f@ f[2 n]], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 25 2016, Version 10 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 06 2014
